comments.body:
Nice idea! I was about to post and idea about this but I found this which is really good! There could be different ice blocks rather than the blocks from the overworld. I would also love to see some mist at the bottom of the biome which could add to the coldness of the biome. Blazes could also take damage when entering the biome (since they are made of fire) which could add a sense of realisim. However, there could also be ice blazes in this biome which could use the icecronium snowballs as weapons. It would be impossible to start a fire there as it would immediately die and lava would turn to obsidian. It could also be the only place where you can actually place water in the nether, but it will turn to ice. I like the fact of a new ore that could make snow balls turn into weapons. And finally I love the idea of a piglin who would attack you even if you are wearing gold armor.

P.S: another note, the developers said that any mob for your biome ideas should be put in there own place, if you talk about your pigwurst mob in another post and link it here, there is a better chance this will get more votes or even get added :).

TambiÃ©n podrÃ­a ser que el fuego que es de color azul se implantarÃ¡ mÃ¡s en aquel bioma y haya otro mob en ese bioma que sea entre de hielo y fuego me parecerÃ­a grandioso ver algo asÃ­ y que cada aldea depende del bioma que este sea diferente

The ore and the mob is cool. But the shape of the biome lacks originality (I mean except the ice) maybe no lands next to lava, but small ices blocs or islands surrounded by basalt. And an full iced ceiling.
This contradicts that idea of the Nether. Almost of it is in lava, random fires, mobs that are fire resistant and use fire as a mean of an attack
This is awesome, I was about to suggest something similar and then read this, it needs to be added!

Biome Description: A desolately cold environment, so cold that even the lava seas have hardened into Basalt, Obsidian, and Cobblestone. Basalt Pillars remain from once-flowing Lavafalls. Massive Ice Spires jut out from the floors and ceilings, and the walls are filled with large ice clusters. A thick layer of frost covers the ground, trapping helpless souls beneath an icy prison. Wandering spirits such as Strays and Vexes spawn here, calling the bone-chilling wastes home. Where water placed anywhere else in the Nether evaporates instantly, here it immediately freezes over.

Biome Parameters:
Generated Structures:
- Ice Spires
- Icicles
- Basalt Pillars
- Ice Clusters

Mob Spawns:
- Strays
- Vexes
- (New Mob) Wraith (Like a Blaze, but cold. Shoots ice balls that slow you down. Can hover like Blazes and have snowfall particles surrounding them instead of smoke.)

The Mether is almost a new dimension, but just part of the Nether. It is a set of frost biomes above the Nether. The nether roof should be thicker, more broken (with small holes), and made of a different material, that can be broken. Nether portals built in the overworld Nether and, never the Mether. The Mether requires it's own portal to access it. Mether portals are built by building a Nether portal made of crying obsidian, and throwing a freezing potion (new item) into it.

The Mether is basically the Ice / Frost dimension (there are lots of posts on different ideas for this), but I think it would be cool if it was above the Nether.
Since water can't exist in nether, i suggest to replace overworld's ice with new ice type, maybe "Dry ice" could work?
Emm, nether is actually a one big cave.
and is now getting a big update in the next year...so maybe some of your wishes coming true :)
They decide what it "should" be. Hope it's not just another overworld copy.
This seems like a unique idea, and considering that we have had a nether update and practically every update changes something in the overworld I also think it's about time the end gets updated!

Nice idea. The end is quite boring the way it is.

Hope the end does get updated during the next update.

A last change that would not have so much relation to the subject would be to differentiate the pillager outpost so that in the deserts they were generated, for example, with blocks of sandstone.

Berries such as the Cloudberry (Rubus chamaemorus) should also be found here. They should be edible and restore 1 hunger point. In real life, they are found in tundras and boreal forests across Canada, Scandinavia, Southern Greenland, and Russia.

And the mushrooms? So many possible recipes with those! You could add a chanterelle to the base mushroom recipe for an extra-nourishing version, or feed it to a brown mooshroom for a steadier supply!

Ooh, or how about mushrooms you can stand on? Big olâ€™ shelf fungus that takes an axe ta break!

Could also put in run-down log-and-plank mining shelters as a unique structure, like igloos but leading to small branches of mineshaft instead.

And ya make those shelters lead ta something useful, how about a unique underground too? Iâ€™d put in veins of clay and increase the number of coal veins in these chunks, to reflect the climate and soil composition of this cooler biome.

Que ideia foda!!
Yes! Yes! Yes! Yes! Please! I'd love to see that!
Ã“tima ideia!
AÃ­ sim
Mojang, hire this magnificent human being.

The April fools dimensions have been something i have ALWAYS wanted in Minecraft. I have always turned to Mystcraft for extra dimensions. The pure amount of extra content added for the "joke" is absolutely amazing!
I Completely agree it is the most interesting thing we have received in a while and it has endless possibilities !
I agree, this concept has so much potential, it'd be a waste to make it a temporary feature.

In my opinion, the endless dimensions are so un-minecrafty. They belong in mod packs of nightmares. I almost cried when I thought this would be a permanent feature. Please mojang, don't add this monstrosity of an update. It was only cool as a joke.
I think it's a good idea to be able to add new dimensions and customize them: their biomes, the terrain generation, structures, and mobs in each biome. It's clearly possible.

Yes this should be an actual part of the game-- but I recognize that some of the worldgen such as elytra boats being so easily accessible is OP for midgame nether access. Maybe change the item required to create one of these portals so that you have to reach endgame before you can make the portal books for one thing.
I think you should get a secret achievement going to a random dimension
I just wanna say, no. Itâ€™s nothing like a Minecrafty vibe. Imagine coming into a dimension only to be killed by ghosts, blazes, blue endermen and red withers. Just no.

Love the concept too, but instead of including it in the core gameplay, why not make a gamerule about it that people can activate and it will unlock the craft for the box of infinite universes and so on.

Yes! This should most definitely be part of "core" Minecraft. That being said, it should either be controlled via gamerule or worldcreation setting so that people could turn it off if they want. I could see limiting it somehow to something you need to defeat the Ender Dragon to get could be good, too. Maybe Dimensional Portals need to have Purpur cornerstones or something?

Anyway, these were a lot of fun; and I really want this to be a part of regular Minecraft.

Oh, the option to use these to make old-school "custom" worlds again would be great, too. Obviously it is possible. I'm still running on my 1.7 world (that I pre-generated out a km or two in every direction before updating) just so that I could have a world with some tweaked generation. (a bit more chaotic, a bit more mysterious, and somewhat more resources, mainly)

As others have said in the comments, this should just be an option in world gen or a gamerule. I believe that the generation system for the dimensions needs a ton of improvement, though. It would make for a great optional feature.

Okay, I'm gonna be 100% serious. Adding this april fools update in this current state is not a good idea for a lot of reasons.

#1 The dimensions are all way to nonsensical and broken feeling.
#2 They are horribly unbalanced.
#3 They are just hollow land with no new gameplay elements added. and mob randomization is terrible.

However randomized extra dimensions can be done in a proper and non-ridiculous way.

#1 Make the dimensions never resemble the three main dimensions.
#2 Balance and limit the randomization.
#3 Create a set of randomized gameplay elements, like randomized ores, block effects, physical laws, and maybe even mobs.
#4 If the dimensions has a sky, make the sky not resemble the overworld sky, one way is to add more celestial objects with different behaviors.
#5 Create a new type of portal for traveling to these dimensions and make it an end game endeavor.

The idea is that these dimensions should be actually alien and more importantly, believable.
I think that this feature has to be only avaible in creative; It would be a mess making this for survival

If anything, I would prefer this to be a part of a datapack released by Mojang, and available on the Minecraft website. Making "the infinite update" a part of the game would be a little overpowered, especially since it's so easy to go into another dimension and find entire worlds made of diamonds. Now, if there was a datapack released, this would solve two problems at once. People who want it added to the game could download the datapack, and people who hated the joke could just avoid it and keep playing without it. Good idea just the same!
I love the idea of the ice floor breaking and Ickes falling.
WOAH!!!  THIS IS A FREAKING AWESOME IDEA!!!  I totally hope we get an ice cave like this one!
this is the best idea i seen in months. let hope it come true cause this will be so much fun to navigate in
Amazing, hope this gets reviewed.
This would be so cool to find in the overworld!!

Also it also generates freezing underground rivers made of silt, a new mudlike ice that if you fall into it you may get stuck as it pulls you down, if your unlucky to, it also inflict a new effect called freezing where your heart turns blue and you start taking damage until you die. The longer you stay, the greater the damage you take, also you can avoid falling by using frostwalker boots.
Just imagine traversing the deep cold
Clumps of blue ice also generates

Merging with another post I've just read, this caves, if intersecting with the surface (or maybe any block of air a block above it on the Y axis) should generat powdered snow, like, you're walking without leather boots and is just straight up sucked into an icey cave... Then, below certain Y level, it would replace powdered snow with the very-thin-ice-that-breaks-when-stepped-on, thus creating the falling effect.
Sound cool, it would be interesting if they do add a hostile mob, perhaps a mutant squid or fish that would make it challenging, since the ocean lack on hostile mobs..
This would be an excellent place for the new glow squid! I think this would provide an amazing opportunity for some new sea creatures that only inhabit the deepest depths of the ocean.

This would be awesome, although since itâ€™s the Cave Update this should be a new cave biome that always generates underwater, found deep in the underground (or under deep ocean biomes). Maybe Giant Tube Worms could generate here?
I would absolutely love to see an ocean based cave biome!!  Maybe it could have all sorts of new coral and aquatic plants!!
This biome should also be home to MOB A from the 2017 mob vote
Actually it'd be cool if this deep sea was expanded upon massively and even had some sort of underwater deep dark biome with a warden-shark
WARDEN SHARK WOO
I guess this would generate when continentalness is less than -1.05 (Like mushroom islands) but maybe only in positive weirdness.
I love the idea but I feel like the game would crash a lot more, also 60million by 60million by 60million is INCREDIBLY huge, too huge, I get maybe raising limit to 1000 max, no more.

If cubic chunks was officially implemented There would be no point in limiting it to 1000 It won't really help performance and it would just be limiting people the only reason consuls have such a limit is because it would break their terms of service That's why your phone can handle infinite world generation but your console can't its to protect consumers from potential bloatware

I do see a potential issue with players causing lag by falling great distances in the same way if you use a elytra you can generate new chunks at alarming speeds that can lack servers. However you can't really load new chunks with this method and the new void mechanics would just kill you if you fall too far.

395290306911 has a valid point. I would suggest 256 blocks from bedrock to sea level but most of the 60 million block limit would be in the sky for building insanely large things not previously possible.

I'd like to see the Nether being incorporated into the Overworld and having vertical chunks would allow for this, it would also allow the aether to exists up in the sky.

There are already mods out there that add the nether to the Overworld.
I think the nether and end should remain separate diementions. The nether maybe but the end definitely not.
If the nether remains a separate dimension It would be great to see the nethers surface If there is one. It should generate at a very high elevation not intended to be reached quickly or easily.

I think that the cubic chunks idea would be great and I was going to suggest the same thing, because it would help with most of the things you said I just think that they could expand the height limits not make them infinite.  Also a way to help with loading chunks and using less space is that if you have a chunk that is completely air it is not stored as a file, instead when you load a chunk that is all air it will set the chunk to have no file for it because it knows that it is all air.  The only time it will load these is if the player is in a certain radius from them limiting the amount of air blocks above and below the player.

jakeZulu7913206 the world would only be generated in a cube (or sphere) around you, so not too much distance. right now its generating from top to bottom, because chunks are that large. but there is no need for generating all 60 million blocks of height.

i made a new post about the cubic chunk world generation: it could only generate things you can or could see. so maybe only 2 16 block chunks down from the surface, or even 16 blocks only, in the distance. this would free up resources to maybe make mountains in the distance visible, improving far-sight
Instead of just taking damage after falling a large distance a void phantom could come out and attack you

The void phantoms could maybe be a new mob in a variant of the deep dark but shouldn't have any correlation with the void death mechanic aside from maybe a reference at most. it exists to prevent soft locking and lag just like entity cramming and the current void.

Chunk generation wouldn't be very difficult for the server to generate at high altitudes, so generating chunks at an altitude as high as, say y=2550 would be very easy because of the lack of blocks. All the server would have to do would be to generate a 16x16x16 cube of air, and only save the chunk if the player modifies it.

It might even be worth it for performance to expand the chunks from 16x16 to 32x32, because moving from a chunk of 16x16x256 that contains 65536 blocks, to a chunk size of 32x32x32, it would contain half that (32768 blocks). This would mean that the new chunk dimensions would cover a similar-ish area so hopefully wouldn't be much more work for lower end systems.

Mojang has shared their ideas regarding extending the world height limit. I think making chunks to be 32x32x32 would be alot of work, but so would extending the height limit to 512. Doing something like this would make it possible to have everything at the same level, such as the surface be at y=~70. The deeper caves and the deep dark could be well below y=0. An advantage to doing something like this is: say Mojang wants to add more stuff to the game, the average consumer hardware has improved alot, so they might otherwise extend the world height limit to 1024, or even 2048. If they add cubic chunks to the game, all they have to do is expand the world generation code if they want to go deeper/higher.

Vertical Cubic Chunks would actually improve performance because technically the height limit is a variable that can be changed rather than technical limitation, Vertical Chunk generation generates everything above and below you which is performance intensive for low powered computer rather than Vertical Cubic generation which generates a set amount of chunks above and around you which can drastically improving performance for low powered devices and make Minecraft worlds bigger.

I would love to have gas vents in the nether, but potion of decay ingredients seem like they need to be obtained as a rare monster drop, if at all. I would also prefer that the wither rose stay a rare item, since it gives players more incentive to fight the wither.

Love the rest of your idea though!

Soul Skull

They should add waterfalls to go along with it. And add some new mobs that spawn specifically in rivers.

My idea would be that the start of the river should be at the nearest highest elevated land (like Hills and Mountains), where it starts out with a small water fall and a brook. Then as it gradually moves to lower elevations, it widens, forming small rivers then in to large rivers.

River variants can include:
Shallow River (about 1 block high of water), Deep River (about as deep as 16 blocks), Rapids (a sloped river that's mostly flowing water.

The rivers should always end into a lake or an Ocean biome and not just loop around. If there's a significant shift in depth as the river goes along, that's where the Waterfalls are located.

They should still have Ponds, just make them so they are't weirdly generated holes, they seem more like creeper holes that have been flooded rather than actual ponds.

This honestly needs more votes; it'd be so cool to have more realistic rivers and lakes, they already updated pretty much the entire overworld generation, so why not rivers and lake generation, maybe this could be a feature in 1.19, since it sort of improves the wilderness aspect of Minecraft, it would make a lot of sense.

This is a good idea. Since sand is loose, it would look like the sand is spreaded out. Also it would add in the possibility for sand dunes.
